column4: eh, are you sure you have the original sources.list and nothing else? what about the directory /etc/apt/source.list.d?
from what I see, the back-up is the same as the original sources.list: here's what it gives me when grepping sources: http://www.coppa.org
ups
sources.list
sources.list.back-up
sources.list.d
sources.list.distUpgrade
sources.list.d is a directory, it may contain other files
opera.list  opera.list.distUpgrade < this is what's inside sources.list.d
then you have added the repositories for Opera, i suspect. maybe they've been moved, try to look inside those files and see if the URL they point to still exists
ok, will do that
checked it. they're working fine. it gives me an error for the links which are in sources list
which ones, exactly?
there are a lot, dunno if I should paste them here, all are from ro.archive.ubuntu.com
there are a lot, dunno if I should paste them here, all are from ro.archive.ubuntu.com (forgot to tab for your nick^^)
you can paste the errors on http://paste.ubuntu.com or http://pastebin.com
actually nevermind. ro.archive.ubuntu.com doesn't currently seem to point to anything
oh, actually it pings. but it's down or something.
yeah, they timeout at ping. should I comment them for now?
i suggest you change to another mirror, at least temporarily
just change them to (for example) "se.archive.ubuntu.com"
ok. thanks for the help, man
